head.title: Police Stations Could Ease The Bathroom Shortage

hedline.hl1: Police Stations Could Ease The Bathroom Shortage

abstract.p: Janis Brodie letter on August 6 article suggests every police station in city be equipped with public toilets (S)

block.p: Re ''Sidewalk Toilets Get City Money. That's the Easy Part'' (Aug. 6): Instead of having smelly, garish advertising kiosks taking up valuable city street space, why not have accessible public toilets in every police station?

The illegal use issues (like drug-taking or sex) would be circumvented. A number of other issues could be addressed if not resolved, like the schism between the police and the community. I don't know how far $100,000 would go in renovating the lobby of a station house while making a public handicapped-accessible toilet. But many of the precinct houses could use some lobby renovation. Shouldn't these public servants have a beautiful home base?
